item.title: FTSE 100 Rises as HSBC, Builders Gain; BP Falls
item.description: London’s FTSE 100 rose 0.2% as gains for HSBC and construction stocks outpaced losses for oil and mining stocks.

item.title: Oil Inches Up Ahead of Fed, ECB Meetings This Week
item.description: Oil prices edged higher in Europe as investors await a busy week of central bank meetings and economic data.

item.title: Dollar Unlikely to Fall Much Ahead of Fed Meeting
item.description: Weaker-than-expected U.S. JOLTS job opening data could cause the DXY dollar index to weaken by around 0.5% but investors are unlikely to sell it much more ahead of the Fed rate decision, ING said.

item.title: Hong Kong Returns to Growth Amid Reopening
item.description: Hong Kong’s economy in the first quarter grew 2.7%, as a reopening of borders and China’s economic rebound helped break a streak of four quarterly contractions.

item.title: Germany's April 2033 Linker In Sideways Move Between Auctions
item.description: Germany’s 0.10% April 2033 inflation-linked Bund has been trading mostly sideways since its last auction a month ago, with its real yield remaining at around 0%, UniCredit Research said.

item.title: BP Profit Slows, but Beats Views
item.description: BP reported a first quarter underlying replacement cost profit of almost $5 billion, and said it planned to launch an additional $1.8 billion share buyback.

item.title: Australia, Spooked by Inflation, Resumes Raising Interest Rates
item.description: The Reserve Bank of Australia surprised financial markets by raising interest rates a month after pausing to assess the impact of earlier tightening on its economy.

item.title: Royal DSM Sales, Earnings Hit by High Inflation
item.description: Royal DSM reported a fall in underlying earnings and sales for the first quarter as high inflation weighed.

item.title: HSBC Profit Surges in First Quarter on Interest Income, Accounting Gains
item.description: The bank announced its first quarterly dividend since 2019.

item.title: Reserve Bank of Australia Resumes Interest-Rate Increases
item.description: The central bank surprised financial markets and raised its official cash rate by 25 basis points to 3.85%, resuming an aggressive campaign of increases.

item.title: HSBC's Profit Surges, Lifted by Tight Monetary Policy Globally
item.description: The Asia-focused bank’s first-quarter net profit surged more than three times compared with a year earlier, as the lender continues to benefit from tighter monetary policy globally.

item.title: Hollywood Writers to Strike After Talks Break Down
item.description: Late-night and variety shows are expected to be the first to feel the effects of a strike.

item.title: Folk Singer Gordon Lightfoot Dies at 84
item.description: The Canadian troubadour’s admirers included Bob Dylan, Johnny Cash and Jimmy Buffett.

item.title: A lawyer for Trump again sought to discredit columnist E. Jean Carroll's allegations that she was raped by the former president, after a judge rejected Trump's request for a mistrial in the civil case.
item.description: A lawyer for Trump again sought to discredit columnist E. Jean Carroll’s allegations that she was raped by the former president, after a judge rejected Trump’s request for a mistrial in the civil case.

item.title: The union representing movie and television writers said that they were going on strike after talks with the major Hollywood studios, streamers and networks concluded without a new deal.
item.description: The union representing movie and television writers said that they were going on strike after talks with the major Hollywood studios, streamers and networks concluded without a new deal.

item.title: Federal Reserve officials are on track to increase interest rates again at their meeting this week while deliberating whether that will be enough to then pause the fastest rate-raising cycle in 40 years.
item.description: Federal Reserve officials are on track to increase interest rates again at their meeting this week while deliberating whether that will be enough to then pause the fastest rate-raising cycle in 40 years.

item.title: Foxconn, the world's biggest contract manufacturer for electronics, is trying to back out of an investment deal with Lordstown Motors, raising the prospect the electric-truck startup could seek bankruptcy protection.
item.description: Foxconn, the world’s biggest contract manufacturer for electronics, is trying to back out of an investment deal with Lordstown Motors, raising the prospect the electric-truck startup could seek bankruptcy protection.

item.title: Major U.S. stock indexes registered modest losses, with the Dow industrials and Nasdaq both slipping 0.1% and the S&P 500 ticking 0.04% lower.
item.description: Major U.S. stock indexes registered modest losses, with the Dow industrials and Nasdaq both slipping 0.1% and the S&P 500 ticking 0.04% lower.

item.title: Died: Gordon Lightfoot, 84, singer-songwriter.
item.description: Died: Gordon Lightfoot, 84, singer-songwriter.

item.title: Regulators seized First Republic Bank and struck a deal to sell the bulk of its operations to JPMorgan Chase, heading off a chaotic collapse that threatened to reignite the recent banking crisis.
item.description: Regulators seized First Republic Bank and struck a deal to sell the bulk of its operations to JPMorgan Chase, heading off a chaotic collapse that threatened to reignite the recent banking crisis.
